Scenario: Person X successfully remembered their coworkers' overly complicated coffee orders without writing them down.
Moral Explanation: Acceptable as it shows good memory skills and effort to remember coworkers' preferences.

Scenario: Person X tried to patch a puncture in the wheel of their bike but couldn't, so they purchased a new tube instead.
Moral Explanation: Acceptable as person X made a reasonable decision to solve the problem.

Scenario: I was helping my friend move and she took advantage of my help. She made me clean most of her house and wanted to use my car to move all of her stuff. She didn't pay for the gas that I used or even thank me.
Moral Explanation: Taking advantage of someone's help without gratitude or compensation is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Provided food and clothing for flood victims
Moral Explanation: Providing essential needs to flood victims is morally acceptable and compassionate.

Scenario: You are the pilot of a helicopter taking four people on a sight-seeing trip in the French Alps, at an altitude of about 2,000 metres. At a certain point, the helicopter loses altitude and no longer responds to the commands. You send out a mayday signal and try various manoeuvres, but the helicopter continues to fall and risks crashing into a rock face.To gain altitude, you push the person next to you out of the helicopter. You know that this person will plummet to the ground and will die, but you and the other three will be saved.
Moral Explanation: Pushing someone to their death is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Person X donates blood once a month even though they have a strong fear of needles.
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable due to selflessness and overcoming fear.

Scenario: Picked up a child so that she could see the parade
Moral Explanation: Kind act of allowing a child to enjoy the parade.

Scenario: I went to the movies a couple of months ago, to see a film. When that film was done, instead of leaving the theater, I just went into another of the theaters within the complex. I watched another movie without paying.
Moral Explanation: This scenario is morally unacceptable as it involves stealing and not paying for the movie.

Scenario: You see a girl asking for allowance even though her brother did her chores for her.
Moral Explanation: Exploiting someone's labor is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: You see a soccer player pretending to be seriously fouled by an opposing player.
Moral Explanation: Deceptive behavior, but within the context of the game and not causing harm.

Scenario: When I was eleven or twelve, I called someone a racial name. The person I'd called the name was a sort of a friend of my sister's. It got back to her and she was humiliated.
Moral Explanation: Using racial slurs is absolutely unacceptable and morally wrong.

Scenario: Swore at a cashier who made an error on his bill
Moral Explanation: Swearing at someone is disrespectful and morally unacceptable behavior.

Scenario: Spat off the balcony at the theater
Moral Explanation: Disrespectful and unsanitary behavior in a public space.

Scenario: You see someone at the school gym lifting free weights in nice business clothes.
Moral Explanation: Neutral, as it does not involve any moral implications.

Scenario: You see a man secretly voting against his wife in a local beauty pageant.
Moral Explanation: Betraying trust and undermining spouse's confidence is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Invited an unpopular coworker to go to lunch with him
Moral Explanation: It is a kind gesture to include an unpopular coworker in social activities.

Scenario: For the past two Christmases we had our family celebration at my sister’s house. I’m not really partial to her husband and their kids are spoiled rotten, which makes for an unpleasant Christmas. So for the last two Christmases in a row, I didn’t go visit that part of my family.
Moral Explanation: Avoiding unpleasant family gatherings is morally acceptable, but completely cutting off family may be questionable.

Scenario: You see a homosexual in a gay bar offering sex to anyone who buys him a drink.
Moral Explanation: Consenting adults engaging in transactional relationship, but may be seen as morally questionable.

Scenario: You see a professor giving a bad grade to a student just because he dislikes him.
Moral Explanation: Unfair treatment and abuse of power by the professor.

Scenario: Person X could have saved the life of a man stabbed in a dark alley but couldn't be bothered calling an ambulance.
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable to not save a life.

Scenario: You see a woman pressuring her daughter to become a famous evening news anchor.
Moral Explanation: Pressuring a child to pursue a specific career path may not respect their autonomy and personal interests.

Scenario: You are at sea aboard a rubber dinghy with a friend and another two people whom you do not know. In the distance, you can see a boat in difficulty which has caught fire. The six people on board have jumped into the water and are drowning. To save them you must head towards them at high speed, but the dinghy is too heavy.To lighten the load, you push overboard the two people you do not know. You know that they cannot swim and will drown, but the six other people in the water will be saved.
Moral Explanation: Sacrificing two lives to save six is morally acceptable in this extreme situation.

Scenario: Just a few weeks ago I got a call from my friend's niece. She was living in my town and having some financial difficulties. I told her that she could come live with me for one week just until she got her act together.
Moral Explanation: Helping a friend's niece in financial difficulty is morally acceptable.

Scenario: Person X arrived at the airport only to discover they had left their passport at home.
Moral Explanation: Negligent, but not intentionally harmful.

Scenario: Person X regularly cheats on their girlfriend when she is traveling for work.
Moral Explanation: Cheating is a breach of trust and a betrayal, making it morally unacceptable.

Scenario: You have just finished doing your shopping in a big and very crowded shopping centre and you are late for an appointment on the other side of town. In your hurry to leave the car park, you misjudge a manoeuvre and your car scrapes the car next to you causing a very visible scratch on the door. It is lunch time and there are no people in the car park.After having checked that nobody has seen what happened, you continue the manoeuvre and leave the car park. You know that the damage will cost the owner a lot of money, but no one can say that you caused it.
Moral Explanation: Leaving the scene without taking responsibility for the damage is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Person X put money in the expired parking meter of a stranger.
Moral Explanation: Kind and helpful act that shows empathy and consideration for others.

Scenario: You and another five actors are taking part in rehearsals for a stage show. The lighting technician is adjusting the spotlights and is on the catwalks several meters above. Suddenly, a criminal armed with a gun comes into the theatre and threatens to kill you and the other actors. He is standing right under the catwalk.You activate the opening of a trapdoor in the catwalks in which there is heavy scenery and other material which will fall on top of the criminal. You know that the technician will also fall, and will die, but you and the other five will be unhurt.
Moral Explanation: Sacrificing one life to save six others is morally acceptable.

Scenario: Person X solved a crossword puzzle in the newspaper.
Moral Explanation: Solving a crossword puzzle is morally neutral and does not have any significant impact.

Scenario: Put a roach down another person's shirt
Moral Explanation: Invasive, disrespectful, and potentially harmful act towards another person.

Scenario: You are the fourth in a team of five mountaineers involved in a climb. The head of the team has just secured himself to the rock face when the second in the team starts to slide, pulling you, and the others, with him. You all fall for tens of metres and stop suspended above a crevasse. Your weight is too much and the rope is not going to resist for long.To lighten the load, you cut the rope which links you to the last climber. You know that he will fall into the crevasse and die, but you and the other two climbers will survive.
Moral Explanation: Sacrificing one life for three is morally questionable but understandable in a life-threatening situation.

Scenario: Someone participates in a non-violent white nationalist rally
Moral Explanation: Participating in a white nationalist rally promotes hate and discrimination, which is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Someone refuses to stand for the pledge of allegiance at a public event
Moral Explanation: It is somewhat morally unacceptable as it goes against societal norms and values.

Scenario: A woman at work would always bring in pictures of her dogs. One day she had to make the decision to put her dogs to sleep. So I cried with her and comforted her.
Moral Explanation: Showing empathy and support in a difficult situation is morally acceptable.

Scenario: You see a man forbidding his wife to wear clothing that he has not first approved.
Moral Explanation: This scenario is absolutely unacceptable as it violates the woman's autonomy and freedom of choice.

Scenario: You are a soldier in the Gulf War. An armed group has taken four civilians hostage and threatens to kill them. You have been able to discover where the hostages are being held and you must act quickly before they are killed. You have discovered that a tanker transporting oil is about to pass in front of where the hostages are being held.You shoot at the tanker so that it explodes, causing the kidnappers to leave their hideout. You know that the explosion will kill the driver, but it will make it possible to enter into action and save the four civilians.
Moral Explanation: Acceptable due to the intention of saving four lives despite the unfortunate death of the driver.

Scenario: Helped an older man carry his luggage to his car
Moral Explanation: Helping someone in need is morally acceptable and compassionate.

Scenario: A friend of mine decided to move to the city where I lived. My friend didn't know anyone in the city. So I went to pick her up at the airport and drove her around the city throughout the next week so she could become familiar with the city.
Moral Explanation: Helping a friend settle in a new city is morally acceptable and shows kindness.

Scenario: Drove through a puddle, splashing some pedestrians
Moral Explanation: Mildly unacceptable as it inconveniences pedestrians but does not cause harm.

Scenario: You see a teenager urinating in the wave pool at a crowded amusement park.
Moral Explanation: Urinating in public is disrespectful, unsanitary, and violates social norms.

Scenario: Offered to help a neighbor fix a fence
Moral Explanation: Helping a neighbor is a morally acceptable act that promotes community and goodwill.

Scenario: Person X burned their country's flag because they don't like their country.
Moral Explanation: Burning a country's flag is disrespectful and offensive, but freedom of expression may be considered.

Scenario: You are a lawyer who is working on an important legal case. The presiding judge in the case is someone whom you know from your university days. At the time, you were on friendly terms, but now, after many years, it seems that he hardly remembers you. You know that he has just finished a hearing and is about to leave the court.You organize it so that you meet the judge outside the court and invite him to lunch. You know that becoming friends again will be useful to you in the important case you are working on.
Moral Explanation: Slightly morally acceptable as long as the lunch invitation is genuine and not manipulative.

Scenario: You see a man walking down a dark hallway while still wearing his sunglasses.
Moral Explanation: Potentially suspicious behavior, not conforming to social norms.

Scenario: Person X went to a friend's house to play a card game.
Moral Explanation: Completely morally acceptable as it involves harmless social interaction.

Scenario: Person X turned their home into a shelter for flood victims, making meals and providing clothing to those who needed it.
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable as it demonstrates compassion and selflessness.

Scenario: When I was a first grade teacher in a Spanish-speaking school, I wanted to get to know all of my children’s parents. So I made a point to make myself available at any time of day. Many of them were illiterate, so I wouldn’t just send letters home, but I would call them as well.
Moral Explanation: Showing care and going the extra mile to engage with parents is highly commendable.

Scenario: Breaks the hand of a wounded combatant to gain information.
Moral Explanation: Inflicting unnecessary harm for information is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: When I first went to dance school in New York I lied about my age. There is a lot of pressure to be young in the dance industry. I was twenty and told people I was only sixteen.
Moral Explanation: Lying about age is generally considered morally unacceptable, but societal pressure may influence perception.

Scenario: Person X drove their car the wrong way down a one-way street.
Moral Explanation: Driving the wrong way is dangerous and disregards the safety of others.

Scenario: You are the bodyguard for an important politician. At the end of a rally, as you are getting into the car together with three other people, the secret services inform you that there is a terrorist heading towards you at high speed in a car filled with dynamite. With the binoculars you see a car at a distance of several hundred metres.You shoot at the car coming towards you by aiming at the petrol tank. The explosion will hit a traffic policeman, who, unaware of the danger, is patrolling the area. You know that he will die, but you and the other four will be unhurt.
Moral Explanation: Sacrificing an innocent life for personal safety is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: You see a college president singing a rival school's fight song during a pep rally.
Moral Explanation: It is morally unacceptable as it shows disloyalty and disrespect towards their own school.

Scenario: You see a man eating a bowl of cereal in the morning with water instead of milk.
Moral Explanation: Unconventional but not morally unacceptable.

Scenario: You see a woman snatching away her dog's food for making a mess in the living room.
Moral Explanation: Moderately acceptable as it teaches discipline but could be handled differently.

Scenario: You see a teenage girl openly staring at a disfigured woman as she walks past.
Moral Explanation: Lack of empathy and respect for others' feelings.

Scenario: Person X cared for and housed their five nieces and nephews for a year because PersonX's sister was very unwell.
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable as Person X provided care and housing for their nieces and nephews in a time of need.

Scenario: Made breakfast for his wife on her birthday
Moral Explanation: Kind and thoughtful gesture on a special occasion.

Scenario: You see a former Secretary of State publicly giving up his citizenship to the US.
Moral Explanation: Neutral, as it is a personal choice and does not directly harm others.

Scenario: You are a worker in an atomic energy plant. Following an explosion, there has been a leakage of radioactivity in your work area, where there are another three people. The doors are blocked because the security system has activated, but the decontamination and communications systems have broken down. If you remain exposed to the radiation you will die in a short time.You activate the ventilation system to divert the radioactivity towards another work division. You know that there is a worker in the area who will die from the radiation, but you and the other three workers will be saved.
Moral Explanation: Sacrificing one life to save three others is morally acceptable, but still involves a difficult ethical decision.

Scenario: Told a joke about a nun on a train
Moral Explanation: Subjective, depends on the content and context of the joke.

Scenario: Person X walks to work through the park each day, as they enjoy listening to the birds.
Moral Explanation: Enjoying nature and walking to work is morally acceptable.

Scenario: Ignored a neighbor's request to borrow some tools
Moral Explanation: Ignoring a neighbor's request is somewhat morally unacceptable.

Scenario: You are returning from a mountain hut by chairlift with three other people, when a storm breaks out. Lightning hits the cable. The chairlift stalls and you are stuck swinging in the air at a height of tens of metres. The mechanism which fixes your chair to the cable has been seriously damaged and is starting to disintegrate.You push the person next to you off the chair to lighten the load. You know that this person will fall to their death, but you and the other two will be able to resist until help arrives.
Moral Explanation: Pushing someone to their death is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Before I was in the actor's union, I used to lie and say I was in the union anyway. When you are working as an actor doing background work, it really changes how they treat you if you are a union member. So I would pretend I was in the union.
Moral Explanation: Neutral, as it involves deception but does not cause harm.

Scenario: Helped a neighbor move his piano
Moral Explanation: Helping a neighbor is a morally acceptable act.

Scenario: Tripped someone in the hall
Moral Explanation: Tripping someone is generally considered morally unacceptable behavior.

Scenario: Person X jumped off a boat to save a drowning friend even though this put PersonX's own life at risk.
Moral Explanation: Selfless act of saving a life, highly morally acceptable.

Scenario: For some time your knee has been hurting when you walk. You therefore decided to make an appointment with an orthopaedic consultant, which has been fixed for a month’s time. Several days ago, you told a friend about your problem and he was able to organize an appointment for you much sooner than the one you fixed.You go to the appointment which your friend organized, without bothering to cancel the one you booked. You know that many patients’ problems are serious.
Moral Explanation: Slightly morally acceptable as the person sought earlier treatment, but should have canceled the original appointment.

Scenario: I remember getting married when I was 17 years old. I got married just so I could get away from my mother. I certainly felt relieved to separate myself from her.
Moral Explanation: Neutral, as it depends on the specific circumstances and reasons behind the decision.

Scenario: Person X put on a suit and wore their lucky socks in preparation for a job interview.
Moral Explanation: Wearing a suit and lucky socks for a job interview is a personal choice and does not have any moral implications.

Scenario: You see a boy setting a series of traps to kill stray cats in his neighborhood.
Moral Explanation: Killing animals is morally unacceptable and cruel.

Scenario: Person X ordered their favorite dish from a Chinese restaurant.
Moral Explanation: Neutral, ordering food from a Chinese restaurant is morally neutral.

Scenario: Volunteered his time as a big brother to a fatherless child
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable as it shows compassion and support for a fatherless child.

Scenario: Worked on a campaign to release prisoners of war
Moral Explanation: Releasing prisoners of war is morally acceptable as it promotes justice and compassion.

Scenario: You see a girl ignoring her father's orders by taking the car after her curfew.
Moral Explanation: Disobeying parental orders is generally considered morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Sells drugs to high school sudents
Moral Explanation: Selling drugs to high school students is absolutely unacceptable and morally wrong.

Scenario: When my first husband and I split up, I was seventeen years old with a six-month-old baby and working in a grocery store. Sometimes I would just take things I needed. I remember taking cans of tuna, milk and loaves of bread.
Moral Explanation: Taking items without paying is morally wrong, but the circumstances may mitigate the severity.

Scenario: Person X was unable to fix the dripping faucet so they had to call the plumber.
Moral Explanation: Calling a plumber for a dripping faucet is a reasonable solution.

Scenario: My friends and I were going to the movies and I was taking this guy with me in my car. He was being a jerk about my driving so I decided to go really fast and drive recklessly. It got to the point where he told me to stop the car so he could get out.
Moral Explanation: Driving recklessly and endangering others is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: You see a mother forcing her daughter to enroll as a pre-med student in college.
Moral Explanation: It is somewhat morally unacceptable to force someone into a specific career path.

Scenario: Smiled and greeted people while walking down the street
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable as it promotes kindness and positivity.

Scenario: Was arrested on suspicion of child beating
Moral Explanation: Child beating is absolutely unacceptable and morally wrong.

Scenario: You see a woman using a fork to eat a bowl of vanilla ice cream and marshmallows.
Moral Explanation: Neutral, no moral implications in using a fork to eat ice cream and marshmallows.

Scenario: You are on board a ship which is sinking. You are heading for the deck where the lifeboats are together with seven other people. You and another person have just crossed through a watertight door when it starts to close quickly. The other six people are behind the door, too far away to be able to pass through it in time.You knock the person next to you unconscious and use his body to block the door open. You know that this person will be crushed to death, but the other six will have time to save themselves.
Moral Explanation: Sacrificing one life to save six others is morally questionable.

Scenario: Gave his seat to someone on the crowded bus
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable act of kindness and consideration for others.

Scenario: Told the owner of a store that she gave him too much change
Moral Explanation: Acting honestly and returning the excess change is morally acceptable.

Scenario: I used to work for the federal government. I used a calculator from work at home for some audits. When I left government services, I kept the calculator.
Moral Explanation: Taking government property without permission is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: You see a judge taking on a criminal case although he is friends with the defendant.
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable as it compromises the fairness and impartiality of the judicial process.

Scenario: Translated menu items for a foreigner in a restaurant
Moral Explanation: It is morally acceptable to provide translated menu items for a foreigner.

Scenario: Person X bribed a landlord to be the first to get their apartment repainted.
Moral Explanation: Bribing is unethical and unfair to others.

Scenario: You are in charge of the division of a factory where wood panels are made. Because of a malfunction in one of the main machines, three workers have been caught up in a roller which is pulling them quickly into a very large press. The emergency system which blocks the machine has not activated and time is running out.You push the worker next to you into the cogs of the machine which operates the press to block the system. You know that this worker will die crushed, but the other three workers will be unhurt.
Moral Explanation: Sacrificing one life to save three is morally acceptable.

Scenario: You have taken your DVD player to be repaired at the shopping centre where you bought it. The technician told you it would cost €100 to repair. Some days later, passing by an electronics shop, you see a new and slightly better DVD reader in the window on sale for €120.You think for a bit and decide to buy the new DVD player, knowing well that the other one has already been repaired. You did not leave any contact details, and you will not go there again.
Moral Explanation: Slightly morally acceptable as the decision is based on personal convenience and cost-effectiveness.

Scenario: Allowed an evicted friend to stay with him temporarily
Moral Explanation: Showing compassion and helping a friend in need is morally acceptable.

Scenario: One summer I had a job on the beach picking up trash. I found a wallet on the beach and it had $60 in it. So I picked it up and turned it in to my supervisor.
Moral Explanation: Returning the wallet and money shows high moral integrity and responsibility.

Scenario: You see a man turn his back and walk away while his boss questions his work.
Moral Explanation: Showing disrespect towards authority figure, but not morally reprehensible.

Scenario: I was on vacation and rented a car. I paid for the parking fee and the guy gave me the wrong change back. I knew he gave me too much but I kept it anyway.
Moral Explanation: Keeping the extra change is morally questionable and dishonest.

Scenario: Person X closed the elevator door before an elderly neighbor could get in.
Moral Explanation: It is morally unacceptable to close the elevator door on an elderly neighbor.

Scenario: I lent my friend a large amount of money to get his car out of impound. He said he would pay me back, but then his wife showed up after several years. She took him for all his money, even the money he set aside for me, and he was embarrassed to tell me.
Moral Explanation: It is morally unacceptable for the friend to not repay the borrowed money.

Scenario: Person X told a coworker that PersonX's brother was HIV-positive, a secret that their brother had told them in confidence.
Moral Explanation: Violation of trust and confidentiality, causing harm to the brother's privacy.

Scenario: I took my sister's ring that was given to her by our father's aunt. I had never met our fatherÍs aunt but my sister spent some time with her. I took the ring because I didn't think that my sister deserved it.
Moral Explanation: Taking someone's possession without justification is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Person X failed their driver's license test for the fourth time.
Moral Explanation: Slightly unacceptable due to repeated failure and potential risk on the road.

Scenario: Stole Halloween candy
Moral Explanation: Stealing is generally considered morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Person X took their nephew to the fair and bought some cotton candy.
Moral Explanation: Buying cotton candy for a nephew at the fair is a morally acceptable act.

Scenario: One night I was going out late and I didn't want my son to know about it. I was a single mom and at that point in time he always seemed to want to act like the parent. So I snuck out of the house to go out.
Moral Explanation: Sneaking out without informing your child is morally questionable, but not completely unacceptable.

Scenario: Person X helped paint their neighbor's house even though it was PersonX's birthday.
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable as Person X selflessly helped their neighbor on their birthday.

Scenario: A few years ago I was living alone. I had an enormous stereo system in my apartment and I used to turn it up very loud. One night I was drunk and turned it up to its maximum volume.
Moral Explanation: Neutral action, no significant moral implications.

Scenario: Someone makes a post on Facebook about how people with disabilities are a drain on society
Moral Explanation: Promoting discrimination and devaluing individuals based on disabilities is absolutely unacceptable.

Scenario: Shoved a man who was passing out leaflets
Moral Explanation: Physically assaulting someone for expressing their opinion is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Circulated a petition in support of equal pay for women
Moral Explanation: Promotes fairness and equality in the workplace.

Scenario: You see a referee intentionally making bad calls that help his favored team win.
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable as it violates fairness and integrity in sports.

Scenario: Gave someone directions
Moral Explanation: Providing directions is a morally acceptable action that helps others.

Scenario: Person X volunteers to teach English to newly arrived immigrants.
Moral Explanation: Helping immigrants integrate and learn English is morally commendable.

Scenario: You see a woman clearly avoiding sitting next to an obese woman on the bus.
Moral Explanation: Avoiding someone based on their appearance is discriminatory and disrespectful.

Scenario: Person X found a wallet containing $1000 and returned it to its rightful owner.
Moral Explanation: Returning the wallet shows high moral integrity and respect for others' property.

Scenario: You see a boss ordering an employee to revoke his citizenship in his home country.
Moral Explanation: Revoking someone's citizenship is a severe violation of their rights and autonomy.

Scenario: I have cheated pretty much all of my life. The most recent time was because I was in a long distance relationship. There were so many opportunities to cheat that I just gave into the temptation.
Moral Explanation: Cheating repeatedly in relationships is considered absolutely unacceptable and morally wrong.

Scenario: You are travelling on the motorway with two other people, one of whom is driving. You are in the right-hand lane. Suddenly, the driver collapses onto the steering wheel and the car starts to gather speed. The truck in front of you brakes and the impact is unavoidable. To your right you notice a lay-by where there is a road worker.You swerve immediately over to the lay-by to avoid the truck. You know that the worker will be hit and killed, but you and the other two people in the car will be unhurt.
Moral Explanation: Sacrificing an innocent life for personal safety is absolutely unacceptable.

Scenario: Tried to involve a shy friend in social activities
Moral Explanation: Encouraging social participation can help shy individuals overcome their fears and build confidence.

Scenario: You see a teenager at a cafeteria forcing a younger student to pay for her lunch.
Moral Explanation: Forcing someone to pay for your lunch is morally unacceptable and unfair.

Scenario: Turned in someone else's project under his own name
Moral Explanation: Plagiarism is unethical and dishonest, deserving the lowest moral acceptability score.

Scenario: Offers food and water to a wounded enemy combatant.
Moral Explanation: Showing compassion and humanity towards a wounded enemy combatant is morally acceptable.

Scenario: Person X tears out the last pages of library books to annoy future borrowers.
Moral Explanation: Deliberately damaging public property and causing inconvenience to others is highly unacceptable.

Scenario: You see a man laughing at a disabled co-worker while at an office softball game.
Moral Explanation: Laughing at a disabled co-worker is absolutely unacceptable and morally wrong.

Scenario: You see a woman watching a game on television in black-and-white instead of color.
Moral Explanation: Neutral, as it does not involve any moral implications.

Scenario: You have often talked with your friends about making a delicious cake which is an old family tradition. You have finally decided to give them a surprise and have invited them to come round after dinner. In the afternoon, you get down to work on the recipe and realise that you do not have any dark chocolate which is what gives this cake its very particular taste.You use milk chocolate which you already have, so you do not have to go out again. You know that your friends do not know the recipe and will not realise.
Moral Explanation: Slightly morally acceptable as it is a minor substitution and the friends are unaware.

Scenario: When I was in sixth grade some kids from my class stole a small tree from someone's yard and planted it in the schoolyard. I went over to the tree and stomped on it.
Moral Explanation: Destroying someone's property is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Person X said it was their friend who had driven into the neighbor's letterbox even though they did it themselves.
Moral Explanation: Deceptive and dishonest behavior, shifting blame to an innocent friend.

Scenario: Participated in an effort to clean up a city park
Moral Explanation: Participating in a community clean-up effort is morally commendable and socially responsible.

Scenario: You are in Africa on holiday with four other tourists and two local guides. One of the jeeps has broken down and the guide has left with the other to get help. While waiting, you decide to cross to the other side of the river in a small boat which you have found on the banks. Halfway across, you catch sight of two large crocodiles. The first violent flick of a tail almost tips the boat over.You throw one of the tourists into the water so that the crocodiles attack him. You know that he will die mauled, but you and the other four will be able to escape.
Moral Explanation: Sacrificing someone's life for personal gain is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: When I was a teenager, I took my father’s car out with my friends. My parents were out of town for a couple of days. I took the car without their permission to go for a joyride.
Moral Explanation: Taking someone's car without permission is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: I was working for a company putting together a project with several partners. At one point I found out that there was a partner that was providing a great deal of money by importing marijuana from Thailand. I didn't say anything to anyone.
Moral Explanation: Remaining silent about illegal activities is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Smoked in a no-smoking section even though others complained
Moral Explanation: Disregarding others' discomfort in a designated no-smoking area is highly unacceptable.

Scenario: Sat in the wrong seat at a game, knowing that it wasn't his
Moral Explanation: Disrespectful and dishonest, but not a severe moral transgression.

Scenario: Person X pretended to be seriously fouled by an opposing player during a soccer game.
Moral Explanation: Deceptive behavior to gain an unfair advantage is morally unacceptable in sportsmanship.

Scenario: Stopped to let another car into the line of traffic
Moral Explanation: Kind and considerate behavior towards others on the road.

Scenario: I worked at a job where I spoke with customers over the phone. One of my customers was in need of help because he was stranded in Romania. I did whatever I could to connect this person to people who could help him.
Moral Explanation: Helping someone in need is morally acceptable and compassionate.

Scenario: At a restaurant, when the waitress returned with my change, I was positive she was $10 short. She disagreed but gave me the $10. I told her that if the register was $10 short tonight I'd give it back to her. When I came back the next day, she said I was wrong so gave her the $10.
Moral Explanation: Slightly morally acceptable as the person returned the money despite disagreement.

Scenario: You are having dinner with some friends in a restaurant in the centre of town. Suddenly, a criminal armed with a machine gun enters. He threatens to shoot at a table where a family of six is seated if his request for an outrageous amount of money is not met. You understand that the gunman has mental problems and any attempts to mediate would be in vain.You push a man who is near your table on to the gunman so that he will feel threatened and shoot him. You know that this man will die, but the six people will have time to escape.
Moral Explanation: Sacrificing one life to save six lives is morally acceptable in this extreme situation.

Scenario: Person X played chess with their friend, winning the game.
Moral Explanation: Neutral scenario, winning a game of chess is morally neutral.

Scenario: Person X always wins at Trivial Pursuit.
Moral Explanation: Neutral, as winning at a game does not inherently involve moral considerations.

Scenario: Threw an acquaintance out of his home for disagreeing with him
Moral Explanation: Threw someone out for disagreement is morally unacceptable and disrespectful.

Scenario: Someone makes a post on Facebook about how worthless teachers are
Moral Explanation: Disrespectful and undermines the importance of teachers.

Scenario: You are a fireman who is trying to save some people trapped in a fire which has broken out on the 20th floor of a skyscraper, which is luckily deserted. Six people are trapped in a room on the 21st floor and are already beginning to suffocate from the smoke, while one person is coming down alone from the 19th floor on foot.Activate the automatic closure of the fire doors. You know that this will mean that the person coming down will be unable to escape from the building. He will die, but it will give you time to save the other six.
Moral Explanation: Saving six lives justifies sacrificing one life.

Scenario: Worked in a state park for a summer
Moral Explanation: Promotes environmental conservation and provides recreational opportunities for visitors.

Scenario: Person X broke a friend's expensive vase and refused to pay to replace it.
Moral Explanation: Refusing to take responsibility for damaging someone's property is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Volunteered to help renovate a church
Moral Explanation: Helping to renovate a church is morally acceptable and commendable.

Scenario: Laughed at a little-league player who ran slowly
Moral Explanation: Mocking a child's physical ability is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: A very large man is leading you and a group of five explorers out of an underground cave on the west coast of Scotland. Because of his large size, the man gets stuck in the narrow opening at the mouth of the cave. In a short time it will be high tide, and you will all drown except for the man, who has his head outside of the cave.You use the explosives that you have with you to enlarge the opening to the cave. You know that the man who is stuck will be killed, but you and the other five people will be able to escape safely.
Moral Explanation: Sacrificing one life for the survival of five is morally questionable.

Scenario: Three years ago I had a call from a friend of mine who was overseas. His nephew was coming over to the States to go to medical school near me. So when his nephew arrived, I just kind of stopped my life for a few days and did things to make this kid's life work.
Moral Explanation: Helping someone in need is morally acceptable and commendable.

Scenario: Person X left their children alone in the car for two hours while they went to have a drink on a hot day.
Moral Explanation: Leaving children alone in a hot car for two hours is absolutely unacceptable and dangerous.

Scenario: Person X did not meet their sales targets for the month at work.
Moral Explanation: Slightly unacceptable as not meeting sales targets may reflect poor performance or lack of effort.

Scenario: You are in charge of a medical team which is taking part in an expedition that will be isolated in the Sahara Desert. In the group, there is a family of five people who suffer from a serious genetic disease which causes vitamin deficiency. You have no drugs with you that can guarantee their survival, and rescue will not arrive in time.You remove the kidney of one of the group to extract the indispensable vitamins. You know that this person will die, but the five family members will be saved.
Moral Explanation: Sacrificing one life to save five is morally acceptable in extreme circumstances.

Scenario: I was at an office party and the company had decorated a room for a fancy dinner. At the end of the night my friend said that we could take the candles that were on the table. She didn't know that we weren't supposed to take the candles, so we returned them.
Moral Explanation: Returning the candles shows moral responsibility and respect for the company's property.

Scenario: Closed the elevator door before anyone else could get on
Moral Explanation: Selfish act that disregards others' needs and inconveniences them.

Scenario: There is a stray cat that comes to my door sometimes. I have been feeding the cat and noticed she became very ill. I ordered some antibiotics from the vet and gave them to her.
Moral Explanation: Showing compassion and providing medical care to a sick animal is morally acceptable.

Scenario: Person X took performance-enhancing drugs in order to win a race.
Moral Explanation: Cheating undermines fairness and integrity in sports.

Scenario: You are the head zoo keeper and you are doing the rounds with another keeper. You realise that one of the cleaners has left the lions’ cage open by mistake. You see that a lion is coming towards the open gate and you do not have time to close it. There are three visitors right in front of the gate.You push the keeper next to you against the gate to stop the lion getting out. You know that the man will be attacked and killed, but the three visitors will be saved.
Moral Explanation: Sacrificing one life to save three is morally acceptable.

Scenario: Person X cheated in a card game while playing with a group of their friends.
Moral Explanation: Cheating in a card game is absolutely unacceptable and goes against fair play.

Scenario: I remember a couple of times my husband and I have brought backpacks with sandwiches and snacks into the movie theater. We do it out of necessity because we don’t have a lot of money and cannot afford theater food. So as soon as the movie starts we take out our snack.
Moral Explanation: Acceptable due to financial constraints and no harm caused.

Scenario: I had a cat for two years before someone moved in with me. He didn't like the cat and he wanted me to get rid of it. So I left the cat at a friend's house who didn't even take care of the cat.
Moral Explanation: Abandoning a pet without proper care is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: You see a boy telling a woman that she looks just like her overweight bulldog.
Moral Explanation: Insulting someone's appearance is disrespectful and hurtful.

Scenario: Always remembers the birthdays of friends and relatives
Moral Explanation: Remembering birthdays shows care and thoughtfulness towards loved ones.

Scenario: Person X helped a neighbor move a piano into his second floor apartment.
Moral Explanation: Helping a neighbor is morally acceptable and shows kindness and community spirit.

Scenario: You see a teaching assistant talking back to the teacher in front of the classrom.
Moral Explanation: It is highly morally unacceptable for a teaching assistant to talk back to the teacher in front of the class.

Scenario: A car accident causes a devastating explosion inside a long tunnel. You and another four survivors are finding your way through the debris to get out of the tunnel. Because of structural damage, a high tension electric cable has snapped and is beginning to swing towards you. The asphalt is soaked with petrol. In the opposite direction you see another survivor coming towards you.You use a rubber-soled shoe to divert the electric cable in the opposite direction. You know that the person coming towards you will be electrocuted, but you and the other four will be unhurt.
Moral Explanation: Sacrificing one life to save five is morally acceptable, but still involves a difficult ethical decision.

Scenario: You see a coach celebrating with the opposing team's players who just won the game.
Moral Explanation: Unacceptable as it shows lack of loyalty and sportsmanship.

Scenario: You see a runner taking a shortcut on the course during the marathon in order to win.
Moral Explanation: Cheating undermines fairness and integrity of the marathon.

Scenario: Intentionally swerved his car to hit a squirrel
Moral Explanation: Intentionally causing harm to animals is generally considered morally unacceptable.

Scenario: You see a man blocking his wife from leaving home or interacting with others.
Moral Explanation: Blocking someone's freedom and social interaction is absolutely unacceptable.

Scenario: Person X kicked their pet dog hard in the head because it didn't come when called.
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable to harm an animal for not obeying a command.

Scenario: Person X shook a crying baby so hard while babysitting that it suffered brain damage and nearly died.
Moral Explanation: This scenario is absolutely unacceptable as it involves causing severe harm to an innocent and defenseless baby.

Scenario: You see a man quickly canceling a blind date as soon as he sees the woman.
Moral Explanation: Rude and disrespectful behavior towards the woman.

Scenario: You see a star player ignoring her coach's order to come to the bench during a game.
Moral Explanation: Disrespectful to the coach and undermines team dynamics.

Scenario: A few years ago I decided to move in with the man who became my first husband. When I told my mom she cried. I wanted to be honest, but she was upset that we were moving in together.
Moral Explanation: Subjective, depends on cultural and personal beliefs about cohabitation before marriage.

Scenario: I used to rollerblade to work everyday. On my way to work I used to pass by this homeless woman named Lulu. Sometimes on my way home from work, I would sit and talk with her to keep her company.
Moral Explanation: Showing compassion and providing company to a homeless person is morally acceptable.

Scenario: Turned the lights off in a parked car
Moral Explanation: Neutral action with no significant moral implications.

Scenario: I applied for a position at this company. As it turned out the pay was not very good at all for the amount of work that I was doing. So I lied and told the manger that I had another job offer and I would take it unless I got a raise.
Moral Explanation: Deceptive and manipulative, but understandable due to dissatisfaction with pay.

Scenario: You are travelling in Yemen. You and another six tourists are taken hostage by a group of terrorists. The terrorists think that one of you is a spy, even though this is not true. You are held hostage for days. One of the terrorists comes to you and reveals that they intend to kill you all at sunset.While he is resting, you kill one of the tourists in the group so that you can tell the terrorists that you identified and eliminated the spy. The person will die, but you and the other five will be freed.
Moral Explanation: Killing an innocent person to save oneself is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: About two months ago, I was in the grocery store at the cash register. This elderly lady left her pocketbook on the counter. So I picked up her pocketbook and called her back to come and get it.
Moral Explanation: Helping someone retrieve their lost belongings is morally acceptable.

Scenario: You see a woman slapping another woman who she is arguing with in the parking lot.
Moral Explanation: Physical violence is generally morally unacceptable and should be avoided.

Scenario: Refused to help a classmate with a homework assignment
Moral Explanation: Refusing to help a classmate is morally questionable and lacks empathy.

Scenario: One time my brother got caught stealing something when I was with him.  My parents asked me what happened, so I had to rat on him and tell them the truth. He got in a lot of trouble.
Moral Explanation: Telling the truth is generally morally acceptable, but the consequences for the brother may be harsh.

Scenario: You see a girl repeatedly interrupting her teacher as he explains a new concept.
Moral Explanation: Interrupting repeatedly is disrespectful and disrupts the learning environment.

Scenario: Person X ordered a take-away coffee but spilled it when they tried to take a sip.
Moral Explanation: Mildly unacceptable as it was an accident and not intentional harm.

Scenario: Helped an elderly woman put in storm windows
Moral Explanation: Helping an elderly woman is morally acceptable and compassionate.

Scenario: I found a wallet with a fifty-dollar bill in it. I found a phone number to call and contacted the woman whose wallet it was. She was very appreciative and came to my house to pick it up.
Moral Explanation: Returning lost property is morally acceptable and appreciated.

Scenario: My friend's family had a clubhouse in the back of their yard infested with rats. They asked my friend and I if we would kill the rats with shovels. So we went and killed all the baby rats with shovels.
Moral Explanation: Killing rats to protect property is morally acceptable, but using shovels may be considered cruel.

Scenario: Volunteered several hours a week at a runaway shelter
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable as it involves volunteering to help vulnerable individuals.

Scenario: You see a man searching through the trash to find women's discarded underwear.
Moral Explanation: Invasion of privacy and objectification of women.

Scenario: Kicked his dog for eating cheese on the edge of the table
Moral Explanation: Kicking a dog for eating cheese is cruel and unnecessary.

Scenario: When I was in my twenties I met a girl who had run away from home. She was 16 and we became very good friends. I convinced her eventually to go back home to her family.
Moral Explanation: Helping a runaway teenager reunite with her family is morally acceptable.

Scenario: Someone makes an obscene gesture in a cemetery for military veterans
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable and disrespectful towards the memory of military veterans.

Scenario: Because of the economic crisis of the last year, the company you work for has closed and you have lost your job. Recently you have been looking for a new job, but without success. You realise that you need some experience in computer technology and are convinced that you will be employed much more easily if this experience is on your CV.You insert false information in your CV about your ability in information technology. You know that in this way you will be considered above the other more qualified candidates and get the job.
Moral Explanation: Deceptive and dishonest behavior undermines trust and fairness in the job market.

Scenario: Yelled at the delivery man because he was late
Moral Explanation: Yelling is disrespectful, but being late is also unprofessional.

Scenario: Person X hailed a bus and asked the bus driver which stop was the closest stop to get to the city.
Moral Explanation: Neutral action, seeking information for convenience.

Scenario: Gave his balloon to a child who had let hers go
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable act of kindness and empathy towards the child.

Scenario: Person X declined a high-paying job with a weapons manufacturing company because they didn't believe in what the company stood for.
Moral Explanation: Choosing personal values over financial gain is morally acceptable.

Scenario: You see a mayor saying that the neighboring town is a much better town.
Moral Explanation: It is morally unacceptable for a mayor to publicly criticize a neighboring town.

Scenario: Found an expensive briefcase and tried to locate its owner
Moral Explanation: Acting morally by trying to return the expensive briefcase to its owner.

Scenario: A couple of years ago, I was out on the streets using drugs. I had a very young attractive girlfriend. I used to let her do whatever she wanted to do, like prostitution and stuff like that.
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable due to exploitation and harmful activities.

Scenario: You see a US swimmer cheering as a Chinese foe beats his teammate to win the gold.
Moral Explanation: Showing support for a rival while their teammate loses is morally questionable.

Scenario: I was in high school and about to take a physiology exam. I didn't study for the test so I grabbed the exam of a guy who sat in front of me. I passed it around to my friends nearby and then gave it back.
Moral Explanation: Cheating and dishonesty are morally unacceptable actions.

Scenario: Person X failed a student because they were African American.
Moral Explanation: Racial discrimination is absolutely unacceptable and morally wrong.

Scenario: You see a teenage male in a dorm bathroom secretly using a stranger's toothbrush.
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable invasion of personal hygiene and privacy.

Scenario: Fixed a friend's broken laptop
Moral Explanation: Helping a friend by fixing their broken laptop is morally acceptable.

Scenario: You are on a trip to Nepal with some other tourists. Your aeroplane has crashed in the Himalayas and only five of you have survived. You have no food and the temperature is below zero. The only possibility of surviving is to go on foot to a small village which is on the other side of the mountain. One of the survivors is injured and is slowing you down.You shoot the injured person so that you can make faster progress. This person will die, but you and the rest of the group will be able to reach the village and will all survive.
Moral Explanation: Taking a life for personal gain is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Person X learned a secret prize-winning pie recipe from their grandmother before she died.
Moral Explanation: Learning a family recipe is morally acceptable and a way to preserve heritage.

Scenario: I keep promising to take my kids to Disney World. They keep asking me when we are going to go. We still haven't gone and I still keep telling them we will go.
Moral Explanation: Deceptive and unfair to the kids' expectations and trust.

Scenario: Person X was singing loudly to their favorite song in the car.
Moral Explanation: Subjective, but generally acceptable as long as it doesn't disturb others.

Scenario: Person X won a weightlifting contest at their gym, after placing second for the last three years.
Moral Explanation: Acceptable as it shows improvement and dedication to achieve success.

Scenario: Talked to a lonely child at the company picnic for an hour
Moral Explanation: Showing kindness and empathy towards a lonely child is morally acceptable.

Scenario: Provoked a stranger into a fight
Moral Explanation: Provoking violence is morally unacceptable and can lead to harm.

Scenario: Made a prank phone call
Moral Explanation: Prank calls can cause distress and invade privacy, making them morally unacceptable.

Scenario: You see a father requiring his son to take up the family restaurant business.
Moral Explanation: Moderately acceptable as it respects family traditions but limits the son's freedom of choice.

Scenario: Person X called the bank to tell them about money deposited into PersonX's bank account by accident.
Moral Explanation: Person X acted ethically by informing the bank about the accidental deposit.

Scenario: You work as the night caretaker in a small provincial hospital. During one of your rounds you realise that, because of a laboratory accident, some highly toxic fumes are spreading through the ventilation system towards a room in which there are five patients. In another room in the same ward there is just one patient.You activate a switch which allows the toxic fumes to be diverted away from the room. You know that the fumes will be directed to the single room where the patient will die, but the other five will be saved.
Moral Explanation: Saving five lives outweighs sacrificing one life.

Scenario: You see a girl and her sister making out with each other just for practice.
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable due to incestuous nature and potential harm.

Scenario: Refused to give his seat on the bus to an elderly woman
Moral Explanation: Refusing to give a seat to an elderly woman is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Went to the grocery store for his sick wife
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable as it shows care and concern for a sick spouse.

Scenario: You see a man in a bar using his phone to watch people having sex with animals.
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable and morally reprehensible behavior.

Scenario: Someone makes a joke about how members of a specifc religious group are dumb
Moral Explanation: Highly offensive and disrespectful towards a specific religious group.

Scenario: Person X yelled at an elderly person for walking too slowly and being in the way.
Moral Explanation: Yelling at an elderly person is disrespectful and lacks empathy.

Scenario: You see an American telling foreigners that the US is an evil force in the world.
Moral Explanation: Expressing negative opinions about one's own country is generally acceptable, but calling it evil may be extreme.
